pros: Dedicated team, flexibility in working with patients.
cons: Long hours (but less days worked in the week), limited procedures.

job_title: Psychiatric Nurse Practitioner in Wenatchee, WA
pros: - Coworkers are friendly, knowledgeable, and deeply caring
cons: - Values misalignment; decision-making did not seem consistent with values, e.g. prioritizing expansion over improvement - Lack of clinical support; there appeared to be a culture of "making do with less" rather than improving care - Lack of prioritization of employee engagement and quality of life; including overreliance on sign-on bonuses to attract and retain staff but then not improve working conditions

pros: Great mission that the organization tries to live by.Amazing coworkers and family atmosphere. True opportunity to use ALL of your nurse practitioner skills to help those who need it most
cons: Lots of changes and growing pains in the last few years that were sometimes hard to deal with but all fir a great cause!

pros:
*Helpful, kind, and motivated staff
*Beautiful work environment
*Making a positive impact on the lives of others
*Get to work in the healthcare industry
cons: *Some of the mandatory staff training modules (like learning how to don and duff PPE) do not relate to the interns scope of practice, but were still interesting to learn about.

review_title: Taking full advantage of your good intentions
pros: Great population to work with, great staff. Awesome healthcare benefits and retirement plan.
cons: Administration is top heavy and unwieldy, provider compensation is too complex and the goalposts are systematically moved so one can never earn a fair market salary.

job_title: IT Technical Support Specialist in East Wenatchee, WA
pros: Entry level position with steady work.Clean facilities and good insurance benefits.
cons: Management, company vision, executive team are all big issues. They hire and fire people very quickly then finding soloutions to train and retain staff.
